body.p: graphic imagecreate bitmapbitmapcreateThe Image Editor allows you to draw a bitmap image and store it in a compilable resource method. The Image Editor is best suited for producing small images, such as for cursor shapes or icons.

To use the Image Editor, you must have the UIPainter parcel loaded.
Open an Image Editor, for example, by choosing Painter → Image Editor from the Launcher window.
Paint the desired image in the scrollable pixel grid. To do this, click on a color and then click on each pixel to be painted that color.
Use the Image Editor's Install button to a create method that returns the image, typically a class method in a resource protocol of an application model class.

topic.title: Capture an image from the screen

li.p: In an Image Editor, choose the Image → Capture command. The cursor changes to a cross-hair.
Press the <Select> mouse button at the upper-left corner of the desired rectangle, drag to the lower-right corner, and then release the mouse button.
If desired, edit the captured image by changing the color of individual pixels.
Use the Image Editor's Install button to create a method that returns the image, typically a class method in a resource protocol of an application model class.

topic.title: Produce a mask with the Image Editor

body.p: Image Editorcreate maskgraphic imagecreate maskTo convert a color image into a mask, use the Draw → Color to B&W command in the Image Editor. Any non-white colors will be converted to black.
To convert a color image into a mask only when installing it in an application model, enable Image → Store B&W Mask, and then use the Image → Install....
Enabling Image → Store B&W Mask will change the Image Editor palette to display only black and white buttons; use these buttons to select the mask and transparency colors.
